## R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r cars, results='asis'}
library(tidyverse)
cor_matrix <- cor(matrix(rnorm(36), ncol = 6))

diag(cor_matrix) <- ""
cor_matrix[lower.tri(cor_matrix)] <- "â—‰"

cor_matrix %>% 
  kableExtra::kable(caption = 'test') %>% 
  kableExtra::kable_styling(bootstrap_options = c("striped", "hover")) %>%
  kableExtra::column_spec(1, bold=TRUE) 

```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}


# Create a sample correlation matrix
set.seed(123)
cor_matrix <- cor(matrix(rnorm(36), ncol = 6))

# Find the column and row numbers of the lower triangle
lower_triangle <- lower.tri(cor_matrix, diag = FALSE)
row_numbers <- row(lower_triangle)[lower_triangle]
col_numbers <- col(lower_triangle)[lower_triangle]

# Print the results
cat("Row Numbers of Lower Triangle:", row_numbers, "\n")
cat("Column Numbers of Lower Triangle:", col_numbers, "\n")



```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
